title: The Zero Product Property
text: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
speech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
pacedSpeech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.

title: Factoring the Equation
text: We can factor $$n^2-5n+6=0$$ to use the zero product property. $$n^2-5n+6=\left(n-6\right) \left(n+1\right)=0$$
speech: We can factor  n squared minus 5 n plus 6 is equal to 0  to use the zero product property.  n squared, minus 5 n plus 6 is equal to parentheses n minus 6,  times, parentheses n plus 1,  is equal to 0
pacedSpeech: We can factor   n squared minus 5 n plus 6 is equal to 0
to use the zero product property.   n squared, minus 5 n plus 6 is equal to  n minus 6,  times,  n plus 1,  is equal to 0

title: Using the Zero Product Property
text: As per the zero product property, if $$\left(n-6\right) \left(n+1\right)=0$$, then either $$n-6$$ or $$n+1$$ is equal to $$0$$. Setting both of these to $$0$$, we get $$n=6$$ or $$n=-1$$. Summing these values, we get $$5$$
speech: As per the zero product property, if  parentheses n minus 6,  times, parentheses n plus 1,  is equal to 0 , then either  n, minus 6  or  n, plus, 1  is equal to  0 . Setting both of these to  0 , we get  n is equal to 6  or  n, is equal to, negative 1 . Summing these values, we get  5
pacedSpeech: As per the zero product property, if    n minus 6,  times,  n plus 1,  is equal to 0
, we get   n is equal to 6
or   n, is equal to, negative 1
